Unknown.translation: If I cut every part of my body from nails to the top of my head into the size of a hair and sacrifice them over the holy feet of the Sikhs of Guru'

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: nhuM qoˆ lY ky isr dI cotI qk Awpxy swry AMgwˆ nUM k`t k`t ky vwl vwl ijMny kr ky is`Kwˆ dy crnwˆ aupr vwr dyeIey[

lines.gurmukhi: Agin jlwie Puin pIsn pIswie qwNih; lY aufy pvn huie Aink pRkwrIAY [

Unknown.translation: And then these cut parts are burnt in fire, ground to ashes in a mill-stone and these ashes are blown all over by the wind;

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: aunHwˆ toitAwˆ nUM A`g nwl swV kyqy iPr c`kI ivc pIh dyeIey; jo vwXU lY au`fy qy auh Anyk ho ky PYl jwvy[

lines.gurmukhi: jq kq isK pg DrY gur pMQ pRwq; qwhU qwhU mwrg mY Bsm kY fwrIAY [

Unknown.translation: Spread these ashes of my body on the paths leading to the door of the True Guru, that the Sikhs of the Guru take at the ambrosial hour;

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijQy ikqy isK svyry auT gurU vl nUM jwˆdy rsqy ivc pYr Drdy hn; aus aus rsqy ivc ies Bsm nUM ivCw dy[

Unknown.translation: So that the touch of the feet of the Sikhs treading that path may keep me engrossed in the remembrance of my Lord. I may then pray before these Gursikhs to take me·-the sinner across the worldly ocean.  (672)

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: qwˆ jo aunHwˆ gurU mwrg ivc c`lx vwly isKwˆ dy pYrwˆ nwˆl myrI ilv lgI rhy qy mY bynqI krdw rhwˆ ik hy dieAw dy Gr gurisKo! mYˆ piqq dw BI pwr auqwrw kro ]672]
